Calculate empirical semi variance from genotype matrix.

Calculate empirical semi variance from genotype matrix.

CalculateEmpiricalGenSemivariogram(X, ploidy, coord, breaks = "FD",
  na.rm = TRUE)

Arguments

X

Genotype matrix.
ploidy

The number of chromosome.
coord

Coordinate matrix.
breaks

Same parameter that in hist R base function.
na.rm

A logical indicating whether missing values should be removed.

Value

Semi-variance

Examples

library(tess3r)

data("data.for.test", package = "tess3r")
em.vario <- CalculateEmpiricalGenSemivariogram(X = data.for.test$X,
                                ploidy = 1,
                                coord = data.for.test$coord,
                                breaks = "FD",
                                na.rm = TRUE)
#> Computing distance matrices
#> Computing semi variance
ggplot2::ggplot(em.vario, ggplot2::aes(x = h, y = semi.variance, size = size)) +
               ggplot2::geom_point()
